titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Solly Family genealogy collection 1990.022
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:11:17 +0000.

physdesc.extent: in one folder and one oversize box.

did.abstract: This collection includes one manuscript volume account by Nathaniel Neal Solly regarding various ancestors and family members. The volume gives a detailed account of the Solley family history and includes charts, seals, and a rendering of the family's coat of arms. Also included is one oversize genealogical chart of the Solly family. Although they primarily document the Solly family of Kent, England, the volume and chart were found in Brooklyn, N.Y. upon the building of St. Stephen's Lutheran Church School at Newkirk Avenue and 28th Street.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Solly Family genealogy collection, 1990.022, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.
